macrtools 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Find, Install, or Uninstall gfortran

    gfortran.Rd

    Set of functions that seek to identify whether gfortran was installed, allow gfortran to be installed, and removing gfortran.

    Usage

    is_gfortran_installed()

gfortran_install(verbose = TRUE, password = NULL)

gfortran_uninstall(verbose = TRUE, password = NULL)

gfortran_update(verbose = TRUE, password = NULL)

    Arguments

    verbose

    Display messages indicating status

    password

    Password for user account to install software. Default is NULL.

    Check if gfortran is installed

    Checks using the gfortran --version command to see if a response is present.

    Uninstalling gfortran

    The gfortran_uninstall() attempts to remove gfortran from two locations:

    • Intel (x86_64)

      • /usr/local/gfortran

      • /usr/local/bin/gfortran

    • M1/M2 (aarch64)

      • /opt/r/arm64/gfortran/

      • /opt/r/arm64/bin/gfortran

    Using the R sanitized shell command of:

    sudo -kS rm -r /usr/local/gfortran /usr/local/bin/gfortran

    Or:

    sudo -kS rm -r /opt/r/arm64/gfortran/ /opt/r/arm64/bin/gfortran

    These uninstall steps are based on:

    https://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/GFortranBinariesMacOS

    And the desired path for aarch64:

    https://mac.r-project.org/tools/

    Examples

    # Check if gfortran is installed
is_gfortran_installed()
#> [1] TRUE
